table_description: This table contains information related to a patient's Advance Beneficiary Notice (ABN) documents.

columns.column description: The unique contact serial number (CSN) for this contact. This number is unique across all patient encounters in your system. If you use IntraConnect, this is the Unique Contact Identifier (UCI).
The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.

A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
The date of this contact in calendar format.
The unique ID of the Advance Beneficiary Notice (ABN) document linked to this patient encounter.

table_description: This table stores the data related to the follow up done on an Advanced Beneficiary Notice (ABN).

columns.column description: The contact serial number (CSN) of the contact.
The unique ID of the note (HNO) record that contains the Advance Beneficiary Notice (ABN) information.

A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
The date of this contact in calendar format.
The number of this contact.
Stores the user who did the follow up on this ABN
The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
Stores the instant at which the follow up was done.
Stores the status of the Advance Beneficiary Notice (ABN) follow-up.

table_description: This table contains failed medications listed on the Advanced Beneficiary Notice (ABN) form.

columns.column description: The unique ID of the note (HNO) record that contains the Advance Beneficiary Notice (ABN) information.
The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
The name of this medication record.

table_description: The ABN_NOTES table contains information about Advanced Beneficiary Notice note records.

columns.column description: The unique ID of the note (HNO) record that contains the Advance Beneficiary Notice (ABN) information.
The status of the ABN record.
The user who updated the ABN record.
The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
The time the ABN record was created.
The user who created the ABN record.
The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
The ABN template used for the ABN form.
The name of the payor.
The estimated price for all procedures listed on the ABN.
The communication barrier encountered with the patient involving the ABN.
The instant when the ABN was updated.
A comment for an ABN.
Stores the starting date of service for which the ABN checks are performed.
Stores the date till which the ABN checks are performed.
Stores the unique ID of the linked treatment or therapy plan.
Stores the contact serial number (CSN) for the telephone encounter used for follow up.
If this ABN was regenerated from another ABN, this column contains the ID of the original
The reason that the ABN was regenerated.

table_description: Stores information about the follow-up comments associated with an ABN note.

columns.column description: The contact serial number (CSN) of the contact.
The line number for the information associated with this contact. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this contact.
The unique identifier (.1 item) for the note record.

A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.
The date of this contact in calendar format.
Stores free text comment about the follow up

table_description: This extract table contains information for items in the General Use Notes (HNO) ABN Procedures (HNO 2310) related group. These items are populated with information from the Advanced Beneficiary Notice (ABN) waiver form related to the services that triggered an ABN. A row in this table represents one failed service for which an ABN was generated.

columns.column description: The unique ID of the note (HNO) record that contains the Advance Beneficiary Notice (ABN) information.
The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
The name of each procedure.
This item stores an additional user-specified reason for ABN. The possible reasons based on LCD rules are stored in item 2313 of the ABN record.
Stores the reason for triggering an ABN
Contains the price per procedure (orderable) or medication for an ABN waiver form. This price will take into account quantity of the procedure ordered.
This item holds the modifiers used by price generation code to ensure that we are calculating the price correctly when updating the ABN record.
Stores the price generated by the system for a procedure or medication that generated the ABN
The name of this medication record.
Indicates which LCD category values the given service failed when run through the blackbox
Holds a string displayed in the ABN showing the duration for an ordered procedure or medication.

table_description: Store information about the ABN procedure note for EHI reporting.

columns.column description: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the note record.
The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
Holds a string displayed in the ABN showing the duration for an ordered procedure or medication.

table_description: The ABN_ORDERS table contains the orders associated with Advanced Beneficiary Notice note records.

columns.column description: The unique ID of the note (HNO) record that contains the Advance Beneficiary Notice (ABN) information.
The line number of the order ID associated with the ABN record.
The order ID that is associated with the ABN record.

table_description: This table contains additional information about the order linked to the Advanced Beneficiary Notice (ABN).

columns.column description: The unique ID of the note (HNO) record that contains the Advance Beneficiary Notice (ABN) information.
The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
Stores the contact serial number (CSN) for the contact where the order is expected to be performed.

table_description: This table contains Advanced Beneficiary Notice (ABN) treatment/therapy plan information.

columns.column description: The unique ID of the note (HNO) record that contains the Advance Beneficiary Notice (ABN) information.
The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
Stores the IDs of the linked order templates in item 2050 of the ABN record.
Stores the number of patient order templates in the plan linked to the ABN in item 2050 of the ABN record.

table_description: This table contains additional information about the service listed in the Advanced Beneficiary Notice (ABN) form.

columns.column description: The unique ID of the note (HNO) record that contains the Advance Beneficiary Notice (ABN) information.
The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
The external name of the department record. This is often used in patient correspondence such as reminder letters.

table_description: ACC-NCDR CathPCI Registry v3 Medications - Discharge table. This main columns of this table includes the information related to the discharge medication that was administered, not administered, contraindicated or blinded. In addition to that, there are few other columns which contains data (owner etc) related to each record of this table.

columns.column description: The registry data ID for this record.
The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
Indicate the ACC assigned ID for the discharge medication.

table_description: Stores a patient's preferences for receiving accessible documents.

columns.column description: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
Indicates the patient's preferred options for receiving accessibility-enabled documents. An example is large print size.

table_description: The ACCESSIBLE_SERVICES table contains information on patient's accessible service needs.

columns.column description: The unique ID of the patient record for this row. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.
The line number for the information associated with this record. Multiple pieces of information can be associated with this record.
The Accessible Service of the Patient. This is extracted as the category title.

table_description: Accounts contain information about billing for services, while coverages contain information about insurance payors, benefits, subscribers, and members. This table contains one row for each account record in your system.

columns.column description: This column stores the unique identifier for the guarantor record. This ID number may be encrypted if you have elected to use enterprise reporting’s security utility.
This column stores the name for the guarantor record. The name could be hidden if you have elected to use enterprise reporting’s security utility.
The name of the person to contact for questions regarding the guarantor. This item could be hidden.
The guarantor's date of birth.
The sex of the guarantor. This is extracted as the category abbreviation.
This column indicates whether the guarantor was active at the time of the extract.
The city in which the guarantor lives.
The category value of the state in which the guarantor lives.
The ZIP Code area in which the guarantor lives.
The guarantor’s home phone number (may contain dashes).
The guarantor’s work phone number (may contain dashes).
Category value associated with the type of account, such as Personal/Family, Worker’s Comp, etc.
This column stores the unique identifier for the referral source for this guarantor.
The name of the referral source.
The name of the revenue location.
The category value of the primary financial class of the guarantor (i.e. commercial, Medicare, self-pay, etc.)
The total outstanding balance on the account as of the time of the extract.
The amount of the insurance balance on the guarantor as of the time of the extract.
The amount of the self-pay balance on the account as of the time of the extract.
The category value associated with the billing cycle to which the guarantor belongs.
The category value for the billing status used for handling statements for this guarantor, such as Age and Hold Statements, Age and Send Statements, Don’t Age and Hold Statements, and so on.
The dollar amount to be paid per period if a payment plan has been established for this account.
This column stores the date when the payment plan becomes effective. This column will only be populated if the guarantor is on a payment plan.
The day of the month when the payment plan amount is due if the account is on a payment plan.
The date the most recent insurance payment was received for this account before the enterprise reporting extract.
The date the most recent patient payment was received for this account before the enterprise reporting extract.
The amount of the most recent patient payment received for this account before the enterprise reporting extract.
The date the most recent patient statement was sent for the account.
The name of the pricing contract.
The date on which the contract attached to this guarantor expires.

This column stores the unique identifier for the system user who is the collector assigned to this guarantor. This ID may be encrypted if you have elected to use enterprise reporting’s security utility.
The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
This column stores the unique identifier for the guarantor record. This field will be hidden in a public view of the ACCOUNT table.
The name of the research study record.
The occupation of the guarantor.

Indicates whether the account has any undistributed payments.  Y indicates the account has some undistributed payments.  A null value indicates the account has no undistributed payments.  An N will not be populated for this column.

Indicates whether the guarantor has credit balance.  Y indicates the guarantor has credit balance.  A null value indicates the guarantor has no credit balance.  An N will not be populated for this column.
The Hospital Billing Payment Plan current amount due.
The Hospital Billing Payment Plan current balance.
Last non-demand enterprise statement date.
Last demand enterprise statement date.
This column indicates whether the guarantor should be extracted. If the guarantor is homed it will be extracted, otherwise not: 1-extract, 0-do not extract.
This value is the Hospital Billing balance on the guarantor.
This value is the Hospital Billing prebilled balance on the account.
This value is the Hospital Billing insurance balance on the guarantor, but excludes hospital accounts in external AR or bad debt.
This value is the Hospital Billing self-pay balance on the account, but excludes hospital accounts in external AR, bad debt or that have not yet been billed to self-pay.
This value is the Hospital Billing bad debt balance on the guarantor.
This value is the Hospital Billing undistributed balance on the account, but excludes hospital accounts in external AR or bad debt.
Oldest Self-pay aging date.
This column stores the hospital billing insurance aging date.
This column stores the last hospital billing insurance payment date.
This column stores the last hospital billing self-pay payment date.
This column stores the unique identifier for the default hospital account of the guarantor. The item is only used in single billing office mode.
This column stores the date the last enterprise non-demand informational statement was generated. Informational statements are those with no self-pay balance for the guarantor.
This column stores the date the last enterprise demand informational statement was generated. Informational statements are those with no self-pay balance for the guarantor.

Indicates whether a new guarantor was created as a result of running the rehoming report and performing the rehome account action.  Y indicates a new guarantor was created as a result of running the rehoming report and performing the rehome account action.  An N will not be populated for this column.  This item will only be populated if the guarantor is rehomed.
Holds a pointer from the new guarantor to the old guarantor

A free text comment that can be entered when the value that is considered to be "Other" is selected as the employer. This option is available only if your organization has chosen to link the account employer to the Employer (EEP) master file in the Facility Profile.
If the guarantor is the same person as a patient, this item contains the patient ID.
This column stores the house number for the guarantor's address.
Specifies the next statement date on the client account
Specifies the statement frequency for this guarantor.  Available options are weekly, monthly, bi-weekly, or weekly and end-of-month.
Specifies the day of the week to generate the client bill on provided that CLNT_BILL_FRQNCY_C is set to weekly or biweekly.
Specifies the day of the month to bill the client on provided that CLNT_BILL_FRQNCY_C is set to monthly.
Indicates whether or not this is a client guarantor.
The payment plan duration in months.
The payment plan total amount.
Whether payment plan is on time, "Y" for on time, "N" for not on time.

This column indicates whether the payment plan will be effective until the balance is paid off that is, the payment plan remains effective if new charges occur. This column will only be populated if there is a payment plan.

Indicates whether the payment plan due day is linked to the statement day.  Y indicates the payment plan due day is linked to the statement day.  This column will only be populated if there is a payment plan.
This column stores the unique identifier for the guarantor's relationship to the requisition grouper patient record.
Self-pay balance of accounts in bad debt that have been billed to self-pay.

This column stores the total of all undistributed buckets for this guarantor's hospital accounts that are in bad debt when using account-based bad debt.

The category number for the country of the guarantor's billing address.
The category number for the guarantor's employment status.

The category number for the state of the guarantor's employer.
The ZIP code of the guarantor's employer.
The category number for the country of the guarantor's employer.
Income source.
The category value for the preferred language of the guarantor.

This column contains the date of the next statement to be sent to the guarantor.
This column contains the date of the last demand statement to be sent to the guarantor.
This column contains the expiration date of the billing note on this guarantor.

Current amount due on a hospital account for a payment plan.
The initial balance on the hospital account when the payment plan starts.
The category number of the guarantor verification status.

The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
The house number of the guarantor's employer.
The category number for the district of the guarantor's employer.
The verification record of the guarantor.
This item contains the confidential name of the associated patient, if it exists. This name is used to determine the confidential nature of the guarantor.
This value is the Professional Billing external AR bad debt self-pay balance.
This value is the Professional Billing external AR bad debt insurance balance.
This value is the Professional Billing external AR self-pay balance for the account.

table_description: Accounts contain information about billing for services, while coverages contain information about insurance payors, benefits, subscribers, and members. This table contains one row for each account record in your system. This table is the continuation of the ACCOUNT table.

columns.column description: The unique identifier for the account record.
Current follow up level.
Employee ID number of the guarantor.
Billing note expiration date.

This is the city on the Alternate Billing Address.
The category value of the state on the Alternate Billing Address.
This is the zip code on the Alternate Billing Address.
Indicates whether this is a requisition grouper account.
When using guarantor account syncing, this item is the record pointer to the owning guarantor account, if one exists.
This flag is set if the guarantor is considered "isolated" for patient data restrictions.  Isolated guarantors are guarantors created from isolated patients.

Contains the date that the corresponding coverage was last verified.

Last statement's billed amount
Last statement's insurance amount
Last date the claim was produced
Billing status expiration date
Payment plan frequency
Indicates whether there is VIP status for this account. Y indicates the account has VIP status. N indicates the account does not have VIP status.

The date and time when a Hospital Billing statement was last viewed in MyChart by this guarantor. This field will be updated when either a guarantor-level or hospital account-level statement is viewed in MyChart for this guarantor.  The date and time for this column is stored in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) and can be converted to local time by using the EFN_UTC_TO_LOCAL Clarity database function.

The date and time when a Hospital Billing detail bill was last viewed in MyChart by this guarantor.  The date and time for this column is stored in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) and can be converted to local time by using the EFN_UTC_TO_LOCAL Clarity database function.

The date and time when a Hospital Billing letter was last viewed in MyChart by this guarantor. This field will be updated when either a guarantor-level or hospital account-level letter is viewed in MyChart for this guarantor.  The date and time for this column is stored in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) and can be converted to local time by using the EFN_UTC_TO_LOCAL Clarity database function.
The guarantor's credit score.
Category describing the likelihood for this guarantor to pay.
Date the last follow-up letter was sent.
Total account undistributed credit balance
Account undistributed credit balance - insurance credits only.
Account undistributed credit balance - self-pay credits only.
The billing delivery point is a two digit extension to the nine digit US zip code, with values from 00 to 99.
This column stores the military rank to which the patient's guarantor belongs.
This column stores the military branch of service to which the guarantor belongs.

This column stores the guarantor's military component, which is used to distinguish between guarantors who are on regular active duty and those who are members of one of the augmenting support groups.
This column stores the military pay grade to which the patient's guarantor belongs.
Number of undistributed credits that are marked as for later distribution in this account.
The category value corresponding to the county in which the guarantor's employer is located.

The category number for the alternate country of the guarantor's billing address.

The category number for the alternate district of the guarantor's billing address.

The reason why the account was held in Professional Billing statement processing.

The unique ID of the MyChart account that is linked to this guarantor record. This is used when the guarantor is not a patient in the system but needs to have access to the billing information in MyChart.
Capture the guarantor's country subdivision code.
Mobile phone for guarantor accounts.
This retains the value of the current follow up level (I EAR 3007) when a letter was last generated.
This is the sum of delinquent payment plan payments.
This includes both the delinquent amount and the amount due for the current month.
This is the total amount of the payment plan payments.
This is the remaining amount of the payment plan.
This item stores the Hospital Billing (HB) external Accounts Receivable (AR) self-pay balance for the account.
This item stores the Hospital Billing (HB) external Accounts Receivable (AR) insurance balance for the account.
This item stores the Hospital Billing (HB) external Accounts Receivable (AR) undistributed balance for the account.
The most recent Auto Pay date for guarantor set up with a payment plan on Auto Pay.

Email address documented on the guarantor.   Any clarity report looking for the guarantor's email address must search in the following sequence, and use the first found one: - The primary email address from the associated patient of the guarantor.  - The email address from the MyChart account associated with the guarantor. - The email address returned by this clarity column.
The user who initiated the linked address changes.
The name of the user record. This name may be hidden.
The instant that the linked address change was initiated.
The source record that initiated the linked address changes.
The ID number of the communication preferences record for the guarantor.
This item will store the number of payments that are currently late on the payment plan
This item will store the total number of missed payments on the account's payment plan.

Credit card associated with the payment plan. This credit card will be charged automatically when an installment is due for the payment plan.  This column will be deprecated in the future release as the payment plan is being transitioned to use the scheduled payment framework.  Once the transition is complete, reference the scheduled payment record for the current credit card.

The scheduled payment record (BSP) associated with the guarantor's payment plan. Scheduled payment record is used to define the auto pay payment plan terms, including the payment method, day to trigger payment, and monthly amount.

If Guarantor is on autopayment plan using Scheduled Payment architecture, this item stores the monthly amount to be used for this payment plan cycle if the value is different than the updated payment plan monthly amount in payment plan amount.
This item indicates the most recent date the patient verified the self-guarantor billing information is correct in Welcome.
This item indicates the most recent patient-selected status of whether the self-guarantor billing information is correct in Welcome.
The date on which the last balance notification was sent to the guarantor for their Professional Billing (PB) balances.
The date on which the last balance notification was sent to the guarantor for their Hospital Billing (HB) / Single Billing Office (SBO) balances.
This is updated based on changes to patient balance.
This is updated based on changes to Hospital Billing (HB) self-pay balance (I EAR 20003).

table_description: Accounts contain information about billing for services, while coverages contain information about insurance payors, benefits, subscribers, and members. This table contains one row for each account record in your system.

columns.column description: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the account record.
The Posted Not Billed rule type category ID for the guarantor account.
Indicates whether this account should always be self-pay.
The comment associated with the referral source in ACCOUNT.REFERRAL_SOURCE.
The category ID of the title used to address the person associated with the guarantor account.
The date on which the next balance notification will be sent to the guarantor for their HB/SBO balances.

The annual family income for this account.

The follow-up letter associated with the account.
The comma-delimited string of SmartText records associated with the account.
The number of family members associated with the account.
This column specifies if the account is outstanding or not.
Contains the day of the month that the second bi-monthly payment is due.

Next due date of the payment plan. The date is updated by nightly processing when the closed batch date is the current due date.
The date when the card will be charged for the auto-pay payment plan.
The day of the month when card will be automatically charged.
The free text information related to the reason why the account was held in PB statement processing.

The guarantor's EB Payment History Score.

The last instant the guarantor's payment history score was calculated. (Local)

table_description: This table contains the account status data for each account.
